title: Bucket Properties
description: generic bucket properties for water routing

receivesPrecipitation.description: A flag indicating whether or not a bucket is at the soil surface

useInSMDCalculation.description: A flag indicating whether or not a bucket is to be used in soil moisture deficit calculations

relativeAreaIndex.description: the fractional coverage of a bucket within a land cover type

maximumInfiltration.description: the maximum depth of water that can infiltrate in one day in millimetres

droughtRunoffFraction.description: the proportion of incoming water that contributes to runoff regardless of antecedent water depth in the bucket

characteristicTimeConstant.description: the denominator of the fractional drainage amount during one day

droughtAdjustment.description: exponent for slowing evaporation as soil dries out

relativeAmountIndex.description: proportion of evaporaiton associated wit hte bucket

curentTemperature.description: soil temperature in bucket, degrees C

effectiveDepth.description: effective depth for soil heat transfer calculations in metres

infiltrationThresholdTemperature.description: soil temperature below which infiltration stops

current.description: The current water depth in millimetres

tightlyBound.description: The depth of water in the bucket that does not contribute to either evaporation or runoff in millimetres

plantAvailable.description: The depth of water in the bucket that can contribute to evaporation but not runoff in millimetres

freelyDraining.description: The depth of water in the bucket that can contribute to evaporation but not runoff in millimetres
